attributes.comment:
As legal immigrants working in this country, we strongly oppose USCIS new fee
plan. This plan attempts to enhance our hardship and agony caused by this
agency?s inefficiency in processing immigration petitions. For example, simply for
an I-485 adjustment of status application for permanent residence or N-400
naturalization for citizenship, the USCIS plus the FBI name check can delay the
adjudication for 6 to 10 years! This unreasonable delay is not only a significant
damage to the lives of up to a million legal immigrants, but also a serious harm to
the competence and national interest of this country.

The USCIS has already raised the fees to a level causing heavy financial burdens
on our families. As legal immigrants, we pay all kinds of taxes. Each cent after the
taxes is needed by our daily life. However, the USCIS is planning to collect more
fees from us in the name of funding the DHS security program and reducing the
backlogs. In the past, the USCIS and its predecessor INS, raised fees several
times while promising to deal with substantial backlogs, but the increased fees
have done nothing to alleviate these problems. By the end of 2006 FY, the USCIS
claimed they had significantly reduced the backlogs, but the fact is: Millions of
immigrants waiting for the quota and those stuck in the FBI name check are
simply neglected in their calculations. The DHS security programs shouldn?t be
supported solely by legal immigrants. The legal immigrants? miserable life cannot
afford the bonus of the USCIS employees any more. The USCIS need a true
reform for efficiency instead of confiscating more money from legal immigrants who
have already suffered too much under this broken immigration system.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Lei Hua
